content:
• Friday, February 22, 2013
  • EXEL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EXEL +3%. DSLV +3%. BLT +2%. CY +2%. CZR +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EXEL +3%. DSLV +3%. BLT +2%. CY +2%. CZR +2%.
    After-hours top losers: WETF -8%. SCLN -5%. MMSI -4%. ANF -3%. CHTR -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN +5.2%) shareholders like getting their money back: shares closed near...

    Texas Instruments (TXN +5.2%) shareholders like getting their money back: shares closed near their 52-week high following news of a major dividend/buyback hike. Explaining the move, TI says it believes it can consistently turn 20%-25% of revenue into free cash flow, and return all of it (minus debt payments) to shareholders. On a CC (transcript), management stated its M&A strategy will be "biased towards analog and smaller acquisitions," and that it only plans to spent 4% of revenue on capex until annual sales hit $18B (they were at $12.8B in 2012).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +11%) shares soared to all-time highs after reporting record highs...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +11%) shares soared to all-time highs after reporting record highs in annual revenues and cash flows, and Global Hunter thinks COG is set for a great 2013: "Production growth should range from 30% to 50% in 2013... Were Cabot to do nothing more than hold its recent 1.0B cfe/day production rate flat for 2013, it would represent... 36.8% growth over 2012′s average production rate."

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • ISRG

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +1.9%) moves up today after Goldman Sachs upped the shares earlier to...

    Intuitive Surgical (ISRG +1.9%) moves up today after Goldman Sachs upped the shares earlier to Buy and raised its price target from $591 to $715. Goldman says it sees improving fundamentals and upside to revenue growth, and it's raising forecasts to reflect more significant adoption in general surgery as well as new tech add-ons to support mix upgrades. The moves flies in the face of Citron's comments yesterday and reiteration of a $300 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • LMT

    Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.6%) slips off its highs in afternoon trading on news that the Pentagon...

    Lockheed Martin (LMT +0.6%) slips off its highs in afternoon trading on news that the Pentagon has suspended flights of all F-35 fighter planes, following a routine inspection in California that found a cracked turbine blade in one of the jets. Although it's not yet been determined whether the problem is a fleet-wide issue, all flights are being curtailed until the extent of the problem is reached.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • FSLR

    While Pacific Crest cut its rating on First Solar (FSLR -1.7%), Deutsche Bank's Vishal Shah says...

    While Pacific Crest cut its rating on First Solar (FSLR -1.7%), Deutsche Bank's Vishal Shah says FSLR in particular could benefit from apparent strong demand across a number of markets and what he sees as a better energy policy landscape. Shah cites a possible weening of solar from subsidies in 2014, and the same improvements in polysilicon pricing that boosted solar shares last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • GDI

    Gardner Denver (GDI +5.3%) moves up after posting better than expected Q4. Net earnings fell 11%...

    Gardner Denver (GDI +5.3%) moves up after posting better than expected Q4. Net earnings fell 11% Y/Y however, as the maker of air compressors and pumps was hit by lower revenue and charges associated with its attempt to sell itself. The company also lowered FY13 guidance, but shares nonetheless rose as results comfortably beat estimates, and an updraft from yesterday's $75 offer from private- equity firm KKR (KKR +2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • BP

    BP (BP +1.7%) bumps higher on reports the that the DOJ and U.S. Gulf states are considering a...

    BP (BP +1.7%) bumps higher on reports the that the DOJ and U.S. Gulf states are considering a settlement regarding the 2010 Gulf of Mexico spill. The deal could total $16B and would settle civil claims related to the disaster, and would settle liability owed under the Clean Water Act. The first of two Deepwater Horizon trials is set to begin Monday before a federal judge in New Orleans.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +3%) trades up after pricing its offering of 15M shares at...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +3%) trades up after pricing its offering of 15M shares at $8.40, just a slight 1.2% discount to Thursday's close. The company plans to use the roughly $120M to continue clinical testing of its hepatitis C drugs as well as general corporate expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • SWKS

    With the help of a chip stock rally, Skyworks (SWKS +3.1%) and Anadigics (ANAD +4.1%)  are...

    With the help of a chip stock rally, Skyworks (SWKS +3.1%) and Anadigics (ANAD +4.1%)  are recouping some of the losses they saw on news of Qualcomm's (QCOM) RF front end. Lazard has upgraded RF Micro (RFMD +0.5%), arguing Qualcomm's solution is a "proof of concept" and that the company is unlikely to risk upsetting partners. Longbow thinks Qualcomm's use of bulk silicon and SAW filters will limit its solution to low-end devices. But Signals Research feels differently (.pdf). "Historically, a system-based solution wins since there are efficiencies that can’t otherwise be realized."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.4%) shares rise as the company reiterates it is on schedule to begin...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +4.4%) shares rise as the company reiterates it is on schedule to begin producing liquefied natural gas at its terminal in Sabine Pass, La., in late 2015. But as it makes headway in constructing its terminal, rising costs caused LNG and its Cheniere Energy Partners (CQP -0.4%) unit to post wider Q4 losses (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 10 Comments
  • ELN

    Elan (ELN +3%) says it's launching a $1B share buyback after it closes its restructuring deal...

    Elan (ELN +3%) says it's launching a $1B share buyback after it closes its restructuring deal with Biogen (NASDAQ:BIIB) over Tysabri. The deal allows ELN to move from the current 50:50 business collaboration to an upfront payment of $3.25B and a double digit tiered royalty structure for the life of the complete Tysabri asset.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMAT

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +2%)  in the wake of Marvell's FQ4 beat and solid...

    Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +2%)  in the wake of Marvell's FQ4 beat and solid guidance, and Texas Instruments' dividend/buyback hike. Also norteworthy: 1) SEMI estimates the book-to-bill for North American chip equipment makers rose to 1.14 in January; that's up from 0.92 in December, and the first reading above 1 since May '12. 2) Taiwanese analog chipmakers posted strong January sales thanks to demand from LED and smartphone clients; the results could be a positive leading indicator.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • FLS

    Flowserve (FLS +3.3%) moves up on a slightly better than expected Q4 report late yesterday. Net...

    Flowserve (FLS +3.3%) moves up on a slightly better than expected Q4 report late yesterday. Net earnings rose 13% as the valve-and-pump manufacturer recorded sales growth across all business segments. Sales in the engineered-product division, its largest top-line contributor, grew 7.2%, while the industrial-product division's revenue rose 1.5% and its flow-control division were up 4.4% . Gross margin widened to 33.7% from 33.2% despite a 4.2% rise in input costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • ANV

    Allied Nevada Gold (ANV -6%) plumbs a new 52-week low after revising expected 10-year annual...

    Allied Nevada Gold (ANV -6%) plumbs a new 52-week low after revising expected 10-year annual gold production at its Hycroft mine to 552K ounces from 582K. Average production cost is $146/oz. SA Pro author Thomas Lott - not a gold bug - likes the stock, particularly since Allied's size makes it far more likely to be an acquiree than an acquirer.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFY

    Indian tech stocks Infoysys (INFY +5.1%), Wipro (WIT +3.7%), and Sify (SIFY +2.1%) are rallying...

    Indian tech stocks Infoysys (INFY +5.1%), Wipro (WIT +3.7%), and Sify (SIFY +2.1%) are rallying today. Earlier this week, Infosys announced BigDataEdge, a software/services platform that integrates giant datasets and delivers insights with the help of algorithms and custom dashboards. Oracle and big data infrastructure software startup Cloudera are launch partners. Infosys has been ramping its investments in differentiated services in the face of weak demand for traditional software outsourcing work.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • WBMD

    Midday top 10 gainers: WBMD +25%. EDAP +24%. PSDV +24%. ARUN +22%. BLOX +17%. SSTK +16%. FIRE...

    Midday top 10 gainers: WBMD +25%. EDAP +24%. PSDV +24%. ARUN +22%. BLOX +17%. SSTK +16%. FIRE +15%. B +15%. AVG +12%. RKUS +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: ETRM -20%. MMSI -19%. WIFI -18%. FRO -14%. NVGN -12%. CBMX -12%. VOLC -11%. GMXR -16%. RCKY -11%. REED -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • EDAP

    EDAP TMS SA (EDAP +19.7%) pops today after earlier reporting test data showing high survival and...

    EDAP TMS SA (EDAP +19.7%) pops today after earlier reporting test data showing high survival and salvage rates for patients given its high-intensity focused ultrasound therapy to treat prostate cancer. The study was electronically published in the Journal of Urology, the Official Journal of the American Urological Association.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • INT

    World Fuel Services (INT -10.3%) plunges after Q4 earnings were hurt by softness in its marine...

    World Fuel Services (INT -10.3%) plunges after Q4 earnings were hurt by softness in its marine and land businesses. "Although we believe the shortfall in land income was likely temporary, we are concerned that the prolonged shipping market trough could continue to pressure profitability at the marine unit well into 2013," Evercore analysts say, cutting their price target to $41 from $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • AMKAF

    A lack of demand for container shipping often serves as a bellwether for international trade, so...

    A lack of demand for container shipping often serves as a bellwether for international trade, so bleak forecasts (I, II, III) from Maersk (OTCPK:AMKAF), Frontline (FRO -13.8%) and Teekay Tankers (TNK -2.8%) do not bode well for a global economic recovery this year. For the shippers, demand rising at about half the rate that new vessels are adding to capacity means a rough year ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 3 Comments
  • YGE

    Yingli (YGE +3%) pre-announces a better-than-expected Q4: the company says it will report a ~40%...

    Yingli (YGE +3%) pre-announces a better-than-expected Q4: the company says it will report a ~40% Q/Q increase in solar module shipments on March 4, well above prior guidance for a "low teen percentage increase." However, gross margin is expected to total -8% to -8.5% thanks to inventory and depreciation charges. Shares are up moderately after ripping higher over the last 3 months along with other solar names. Peers are also up: TSL +4.1%. JKS +4.5%. CSIQ +3.5%. LSK +2.9%. SPWR +4.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -4.7%) trades lower today after earlier announcing that a European Medicines Agency...

    Vivus (VVUS -4.7%) trades lower today after earlier announcing that a European Medicines Agency committee has confirmed an earlier decision to recommend against approval of it's weight-loss drug Qsiva.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 2 Comments
  • VOLC

    Shares of Volcano (VOLC -14.6%) slip after revising guidance lower late yesterday, saying...

    Shares of Volcano (VOLC -14.6%) slip after revising guidance lower late yesterday, saying revenue for 2013 will come in between $406M to $412M, on an EPS of $0.08 to $0.11 per share. Goldman cut the stock to Neutral from Conviction Buy on the news, saying the lower outlook points to continued pressure on its base business, slowing new growth drivers, and lower EBIT leverage. William Blair also reduces it to Market Perform, while First Analyis downgrades it to Equal Weight.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • CAGDF

    Political turmoil again engulfs Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -10.9%), as Kyrgyzstan’s...

    Political turmoil again engulfs Centerra Gold (OTCPK:CAGDF -10.9%), as Kyrgyzstan’s parliament approves a resolution to re-negotiate the miner’s key investment agreement. If a new deal with Centerra isn't reached in three months, the resolution calls for the agreement to be tossed out entirely. At the same time, Centerra receives a government claim for $315M related to alleged environmental damage.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • PBF

    PBF Energy (PBF +2.2%) is upgraded to Overweight at Simmons on "early signs of success" from its...

    PBF Energy (PBF +2.2%) is upgraded to Overweight at Simmons on "early signs of success" from its crude procurement strategy. The firm views PBF as "the high reward/risk stock in the refining universe,” with the cheapest valuation and most upside potential. Benchmark ups its target price to $48 from $40, noting the planned expansion of the Delaware City rail terminal offers revaluation catalysts down the road.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM
  • EBIX

    Ebix (EBIX -9.4%) responds to SA contributor Gotham City Research's claims of improper...

    Ebix (EBIX -9.4%) responds to SA contributor Gotham City Research's claims of improper accounting with a terse PR that calls Gotham's assertions "unsubstantiated," and insists Ebix's financial reporting "complies with all SEC reporting requirements." Investors aren't sold on Ebix's defense; shares are now down 33% since Gotham's report came out.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM | 5 Comments
  • AIG

    AIG is downgraded to Hold at Sterne Agee, which says the stock is now fairly valued. Shares are...

    AIG is downgraded to Hold at Sterne Agee, which says the stock is now fairly valued. Shares are giving up some gains following the big earnings beat, but still +2.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 13 Comments
  • CBMX

    CombiMatrix (CBMX -16.8%) gives back a little bit of its huge gain from yesterday, after...

    CombiMatrix (CBMX -16.8%) gives back a little bit of its huge gain from yesterday, after announcing that Mark McDonough, currently the company's Chief Commercial Officer, will become CEO following the retirement of CEO R. Judd Jessup, who has announced he will be stepping down effective March 15, 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • BB

    There's a 90% chance BB10 flops and BlackBerry (BBRY -3.7%) shares go to $7, argues MKM's...

    There's a 90% chance BB10 flops and BlackBerry (BBRY -3.7%) shares go to $7, argues MKM's Michael Genovese, who is cutting the smartphone vendor to Sell. Genovese claims less than 10% of the most popular Android apps, and less than 5% of the most popular iPhone apps, are available on BB10. He also thinks U.K. Z10 momentum has stalled, and that carrier checks "suggest unwillingness to carry heavy BB10 inventory." Several other firms have also issued critical notes on BlackBerry over the last 7 days (I, II, III, IV); shares -15% since the BB10 launch event.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 70 Comments
  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.2%) tells CNBC the layoffs at the company won't be as large as earlier...

    J.C. Penney (JCP +5.2%) tells CNBC the layoffs at the company won't be as large as earlier reports claimed. Though employees themselves are saying over 300 were axed yesterday at headquarters, it's a move the company calls a "minimal team member reductions across multiple departments." Shares of JCP are reacting favorably, clearing $22 for the first time of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 22 Comments
  • WBMD

    Shares of WebMD (WBMD +23.3%) are soaring this morning on a solid Q4 earnings beat and better...

    Shares of WebMD (WBMD +23.3%) are soaring this morning on a solid Q4 earnings beat and better guidance, prompting an upgrade to Buy at Stifel Nicolaus. Goldman's Terry Heath is sceptical however. She thinks, given the lack of viability, guidance "could prove optimistic," as the online pharma business continues to be negatively affected by the shift in use from desktop to mobile and increasing competition in the online advertising market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +5.5%) are ripping higher off of buzz over the potential...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +5.5%) are ripping higher off of buzz over the potential for online gambling in Nevada and New Jersey. Despite the enthusiasm, the company's serious debt load has some industry watchers speculating that the it may need to shed more assets - perhaps even minority stakes in its online division.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • IMGN

    More on ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN): The stock's moving about quite a bit, but currently +3.8%...

    More on ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN): The stock's moving about quite a bit, but currently +3.8% following FDA approval of Kadcyla. The drug is being approved with a Boxed Warning alerting users and prescribers of heart and liver toxicity as well as severe life-threatening birth defects.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM | 3 Comments
  • RKUS

    Ruckus (RKUS +11.3%) soars after GigaOm reports pan-African carrier Airtel plans to use Ruckus'...

    Ruckus (RKUS +11.3%) soars after GigaOm reports pan-African carrier Airtel plans to use Ruckus' access points to build a Wi-Fi network that could eventually have over 100K nodes. Airtel also reportedly plans to tap Alcatel-Lucent (ALU -1.4%) to provide aggregation routers and integration services. Ruckus might also be getting a lift from rival Aruba's (ARUN +19.9%) FQ2 beat. On its earnings call, Aruba, which is stronger in enterprise Wi-Fi, said it wants to deliver carrier Wi-Fi architectures that support both standard Wi-Fi offload and managed services for enterprises.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • FTI

    FMC Tech (FTI +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Dahlman Rose, which detects "a...

    FMC Tech (FTI +1.5%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold at Dahlman Rose, which detects "a powerful wave of orders" that will affect subsea equipment providers for five years and perhaps longer; "no one will benefit more from this wave than FMC." The firm sees a major upswing in earnings beginning in 2014 and lasting through the end of the decade.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +8%) rockets to the top of the S&P 500 leader board after...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +8%) rockets to the top of the S&P 500 leader board after posting strong Q4 beats in earnings and revenues. Year-end 2012 proved reserves rose 27% Y/Y to 3.8T cfe, the third consecutive year of reserve growth exceeding 20%. COG says it had 15 of the top 20 producing Marcellus wells in Pennsylvania during 2012. $1B capex plan for 2013 remains unchanged.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix's (NFLX -3.1%) Q1 sales are tracking to $870M-$875M, slightly below a consensus of...

    Netflix's (NFLX -3.1%) Q1 sales are tracking to $870M-$875M, slightly below a consensus of $877M, says ITG Research; the firm adds the positive reception to House of Cards could lead trends to improve. ITG's comments are producing a moderate selloff in Netflix, which remains up over 3x since October.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 4 Comments
  • ANF

    Heard during Abercrombie & Fitch's (ANF -5.1%) earnings call: 1) The retailer says it...

    Heard during Abercrombie & Fitch's (ANF -5.1%) earnings call: 1) The retailer says it expects Q1 to be on the slow side. 2013 comparable store sales are forecast to be flat as direct-to-consumer sales offset "slightly negative" comparable store sales. 2) On promotional activity, execs call their stance "moderated" during the holiday shopping period. 3) The company's store count slipped to 1,051 in Q4 with a loss of 36 stores in the U.S. partially offset by a pickup of 8 in Europe and Asia combined. 4) Strong gross margins will be largely offset by a deleveraging on negative comparable store sales. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • HPQ

    "Although a number of businesses remain under pressure . the likelihood of the bottom falling...

    "Although a number of businesses remain under pressure ... the likelihood of the bottom falling out appears diminished," says UBS' Steve Milunovich, upgrading H-P (HPQ +7.8%) to Neutral following its FQ1 beat. Interestingly, Milunovich has long called for a breakup of H-P (something Meg Whitman shot down), and it was just 2 days ago he suggested H-P might be to blame for a Foxconn hiring freeze. Deutsche is maintaining a Sell, arguing top-line performance remains weak and FQ1 cash flow was inflated by a tax benefit and smaller bonuses. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIG

    If we were simple, we wouldn't be AIG, CEO Bob Benmosche tells Bloomberg. On the just-concluded...

    If we were simple, we wouldn't be AIG, CEO Bob Benmosche tells Bloomberg. On the just-concluded earnings call, the company didn't give a ton of guidance to those looking for dividends. Management wants to do it, and notes the new class of shareholders a dividend would bring in, but will take its time about it. Shares +4%. (earnings) (presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • LVS

    Casino stocks (NYSEARCA:BJK) show mild gains after Nevada approves a bill to institute online...

    Casino stocks (NYSEARCA:BJK) show mild gains after Nevada approves a bill to institute online gambling. Though a positive for Vegas-centric companies and a negative for Jersey-centric players, until the parameters of online gambling are better defined it will be hard to separate the winners from the losers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:40 AM
  • RSLS

    Weight-loss device maker EnteroMedics (ETRM) -19.5% premarket on plans for a $13M public...

    Weight-loss device maker EnteroMedics (ETRM) -19.5% premarket on plans for a $13M public offering of 13.77M common shares and warrants to purchase 5.5M shares. ETRM had ~41.7M shares outstanding as of Dec. 31.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • ZNGA

    Nevada legalized online gambling last night after a bill was rushed through the legislature as...

    Nevada legalized online gambling last night after a bill was rushed through the legislature as an emergency measure. Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) shareholders approve, shares +3.4% premarket. The company filed for a Nevada online gambling license in December. New Jersey might soon follow in Nevada's footsteps. (U.K. launch)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 4 Comments
  • WBMD

    Premarket gainers: WBMD +19%. ARUN +14%. FIRE +13%. JOEZ +11%. CYBX +8%. MRVL +5%. GLUU +5%. HPQ...

    Premarket gainers: WBMD +19%. ARUN +14%. FIRE +13%. JOEZ +11%. CYBX +8%. MRVL +5%. GLUU +5%. HPQ +5%.
    Losers: ETRM -17%. RAX -6%. FRO -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • FRO

    More on Frontline's (NYSE:FRO) Q4 results: Free cash position $137.6M, -14% Y/Y. Says it will...

    More on Frontline's (NYSE:FRO) Q4 results: Free cash position $137.6M, -14% Y/Y. Says it will continue to reduce its fleet in order to reduce its financial exposure. but there is a risk it won't have sufficient cash to repay a $225M convertible bond loan maturing in April 2015 if the tanker market doesn't recover; such a situation may force a restructuring of the company. Shares -7.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • EGO

    More on Eldorado Gold's (NYSE:EGO) Q4 results: Total 2012 gold revenues were $1.047B, +0.5% Y/Y,...

    More on Eldorado Gold's (NYSE:EGO) Q4 results: Total 2012 gold revenues were $1.047B, +0.5% Y/Y, on gold production including pre-commercial production from Efemcukuru of ~656K oz., -0.3% Y/Y. For 2013, sees total gold oz. produced of 705K-760K, cash operating costs of $515-$530/oz. Shares +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG): Q4 EPS of -$0.19 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $67.4M misses by $4M....

    Cheniere Energy (NYSEMKT:LNG): Q4 EPS of -$0.19 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $67.4M misses by $4M. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) move up 3.8% in premarket trading after the...

    Shares of Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF) move up 3.8% in premarket trading after the retailer beats estimates with its Q4 report . Retail analysts thinks the tight inventory position and the first dividend hike in years from the company just might suggest it's low-balling its guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • HD

    Oppenheimer upgrades Home Depot (NYSE:HD) to an Outperform rating due to what it sees as strong...

    Oppenheimer upgrades Home Depot (NYSE:HD) to an Outperform rating due to what it sees as strong housing trends. The firm raises its price target on shares by $9 to take it to $76. HD +1.2% premarket to $65.15.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM
  • ANF

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (NYSE:ANF) Q4: Comparable stores sales were flat in the U.S....

    More on Abercrombie & Fitch's (NYSE:ANF) Q4: Comparable stores sales were flat in the U.S. inclusive of Internet sales, while international comps slipped 3%. Direct to consumer sales by brand: +4% abercrombie kids; flat Abercrombie & Fitch; -2% Hollister. The retailer sees FY13 EPS of $3.35-$3.45 vs. $3.63 consensus. ANF +0.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 AM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF): Q4 EPS of $2.21 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $1.47B misses by...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (NYSE:ANF): Q4 EPS of $2.21 beats by $0.26. Revenue of $1.47B misses by $0.02B. Shares +1.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:49 AM

  • Some European bourses add to gains after the IFO index improves more than expected and following...

    Some European bourses add to gains after the IFO index improves more than expected and following sharp losses earlier in the week. Asian shares were mixed in the wake of poor overnight economic data from Europe, with China closing sharply lower for the week as the government tightens monetary and housing policy. Japan +0.7%, Hong Kong -0.5%, China -0.5%, India +0.3%. EU Stoxx 50 +1.1%, London +0.7%, Paris +1.3%, Frankfurt +0.7%, Milan +1%, Madrid +0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 AM

  • German IFO business climate rises to 107.4 in February from 104.3 in January and vs consensus of...

    German IFO business climate rises to 107.4 in February from 104.3 in January and vs consensus of 105. Current assessment 110.2 vs 108.1 and 108.5. Expectations 104.6 vs 100.6 and 101.3. The euro jumps vs the dollar and is now +0.3% at $1.3234.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 AM
